Comments_List:
1. MLA citation style (very useful!!!)
2. They say, I say structure
3. Better organization
4. Different view into the world.

I have learnt to to produce speech and argument that are coherent, balanced and effective. The class discussions have definitely widened my perception on culture and I was amazed by the diversity of the answers we produced together as aclsss.
I gained great academic writing ability by practicing the MLA format and formal writing.

Strengths: prof. O'Leary is very patient and friendly, and her annotation under my essay is very detailed. The atmosphere in class is also free.
Weakness: I feel writing assignments can be dispersed into earlier weeks too, because it is kind of frustrating when papers from other class also gathered.
The class was very relaxing, students were able to speak confidently because everyone respected each others responses. Perhaps, the content of the class can be more culture-relating
Yes. Because the professor is nice and the course is really very helpful to writing skill.
its definitely useful as a foundation course, as it provides essential skills a college/ pre-college student needs

Yes. In this course students can meet people from other cultures and can share experiences with them, which will enrich students' knowledge. Students also get access to formal, academic writing, which is the foundation for further success when they step into college.
